result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

9:16 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Anou Lo appeared by phone.  Attorney Andrew J. Burdick appeared by video for Anou Lo.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Burdick is heard on the status of the case.
Jury status hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for December 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial on December 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury status hearing on December 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:30 AM Case called - appearances stated. 
Defendant Anou Lo appeared by phone.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Andrew J. Burdick by Atty. Jeff Ocwieja appeared by video for Anou Lo. 

Atty. Ocwieja is heard
Atty. Steiner states results are not back yet
Jury status hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury status hearing on August 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:31 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Anou Lo appeared by video.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Andrew J. Burdick appeared by video for Anou Lo. 

Atty Burdick waives reading of the information. Defendant will stand mute, upon defendant standing mute clerk will enter a not guilty plea into the record. 
Atty Burdick is heard. Requests more time.
Jury status hearing scheduled for May 26, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Jury status hearing on May 26, 2022 at 10:30 am.

11:55 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Anou Lo appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Luke Steiner in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Andrew J. Burdick in court for Anou Lo. 

Information has been filed. 

Atty Burdick is heard and waives reading of the information. Defendant stands mute.
Requests rescheduling the arraignment.
Arraignment scheduled for March 25, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Arraignment on March 25, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Atty. Andrew Burdick apptd.
Inmate request to Judge Rider and Judge Rider's 3/21/22 response to same

10:31 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Anou Lo appeared by video, in custody. Atty Burdick appeared by video. 

1w- Deputy Joseph Breeser, sworn 
Exam by Atty Steiner 
Cross by Atty Burdick 

D.A. requests matter be bound over for further proceedings. 
Atty Burdick objects to bind over.  

Court finds probable cause and binds matter over for further proceedings. 
Atty Burdick is heard and requests arraignment be scheduled for another date.
Arraignment scheduled for March 23, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Arraignment on March 23, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Atty. Andrew Burdick apptd.

11:33 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Anou Lo appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Andrew J. Burdick for Anou Lo appeared in court, Attorney Luke Steiner for State of Wisconsin appeared by video. 

Court informs Def. of nature of charges and penalty sections of criminal complaint for each count.  Def. states understanding.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on March 9, 2022 at 11:30 am.

1:35 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Anou Lo appeared by video, in custody, Attorney Luke Steiner appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Court finds probable cause. 

DA Requests a $3,000.00 cash bond. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. No contact with LY and PY. 

Defendant comments.

Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. No contact with LY and PY. 

Court advises right to an attorney.
Hearing scheduled for March 9, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant.
